parse.title: Ministry of Culture of the People's Republic of China

text.*:
Ministry of Culture of the People's Republic of China
中华人民共和国文化部
Zhōnghuá Rénmín Gònghéguó Wénhuàbù
Emblem of the People's Republic of China
Agency overview
Formed September 1954
Dissolved March 19, 2018
Superseding agency
  • Ministry of Culture and Tourism
Jurisdiction  People's Republic of China
Headquarters Beijing
Minister responsible
  • Luo Shugang
Parent agency State Council
Website www.mcprc.gov.cn

The Ministry of Culture (MOC) was a ministry of the government of the People's Republic of China which was dissolved on March 19, 2018.[1] The responsibilities of the MOC, which were assumed by the Ministry of Culture and Tourism, encompassed cultural policy and activities in the country, including managing national museums and monuments; promoting and protecting the arts (including censorship of visual, folk, theatrical, musical, dance, architectural, literary, televisual and cinematographic works); and managing the national archives and regional culture centers. Its headquarters were in Chaoyang District, Beijing.[2]

Contents

  • 1 Duties
  • 2 List of ministers
  • 3 See also
  • 4 References
  • 5 External links

Duties[edit]

See also: Public domain and Right to science and culture

The duty of the ministry was to digitize and preserve public domain works, and make them available and accessible to every citizen. China had millions of public domain works, including but not limited to books, pictures, music and films.[3][4]

  1. ^ 雒树刚被任命为首位文化和旅游部部长（附简历）. ce.cn (in Chinese). 2018-03-19. 
  2. ^ Home Archived 2010-12-06 at the Wayback Machine.. Ministry of Culture of the People's Republic of China. Retrieved on December 22, 2010. "Contact us Address: No.10, Chaoyangmen Beidajie, Chaoyang District, Beijing,100020 Tel:86-10-59881114"
  3. ^ Mielnicki, Marcin. "European libraries and Google cooperate in digitization - Digital Libraries and Knowledge Platforms Department". 
  4. ^ Dobusch, Leonhard (5 December 2015). "Public Domain on Trial in Reiss-Engelhorn Museum vs. Wikimedia et al".
